content.question: Which of the following is an implication of the chart?

choices.label: A two-child policy in the 1980s would have been a more effective response to demographic pressures than the one-child policy was.
The fertility rate in China was heavily influenced by the one-child policy, especially between 1990 and 2015.
China’s one-child policy was an effective response to demographic pressures.
China’s one-child policy was unnecessary, as the fertility rate would have declined similarly without a policy restricting fertility rates.

content.answer: China’s one-child policy was unnecessary, as the fertility rate would have declined similarly without a policy restricting fertility rates.

unit.text: 5: Political and Economic Changes and Development

topic.text: 5.8: Causes and Effects of Demographic Change

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
